name: urgency
content:
urgency noun [U]
(IMPORTANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very important and needing attention immediately: It now is a matter of urgency that aid reaches the famine area. She stressed the urgency of an early solution.
More examplesFewer examplesShe didn't understand the urgency of the situation.The urgency of the problem has been highlighted recently by politicians. Recent events have added urgency to negotiations.

urgency noun [U]
(DETERMINATION)
formal the quality of being repeated and determined in trying to get or do something: There was a note of urgency in his voice. They are working with increasing urgency to reach a solution. See
urgent
More examplesFewer examples"Wait!” she cried, with a look of urgency in her eyes. Her work acquired an urgency that it didn't have before.We must settle this matter with some urgency.
